item.title: dunst-layout
item.description: dunst-layout - Dunst layout switcher SYNOPSIS dunst-layout [-v|-h] LAYOUT-NAME DESCRIPTION dunst-layout restarts dunst with the selected layout, merged with a mondo generated theme. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. FILES DUNST_DIR/lo-LAYOUT-NAME A file inside DUNST_DIR containing dunst options. DUNST_DIR/mondo A file inside DUNST_DIR containing dunst options. ENVIRONMENT DUNST_DIR dunst settings folder, defaults to ~/.config/dunst DEPENDENCIES dunst

item.title: polybar_and_workspaces
item.description: This is the first of three videos where I create a dynamic workspace indicator that displays the name (icon) of the current workspace and the total number of existing workspaces. In this first video, we create a new hook module and create the first version of the script that will output the workspace information. !!! The getpid script on github is a fixed version. The reason i got multiple pids was because it returned the pid of the getpid script it self.

item.title: polybar_magic_workspaces
item.description: This is the second of three videos in which I create a dynamic workspace indicator for polybar. The indicator will display the name (icon) of the current workspace and the total number of existing workspaces. In this second video I add fontawesome icons to indicate which workspace we are currently viewing. I also make a small script that switch to the last active workspace or create a new workspace if only one workspace exist.

item.title: uniform_qt_and_gtk
item.description: This is the fifth video in a series on how to setup and use my theme manager, mondo. I use qt5ct to manage some of the appearances of Qt. https://sourceforge.net/projects/qt5ct/ And export the following environment variables (i export them from .xinitrc, but you can export them in other files as well..): export QT_QPA_PLATFORMTHEME=qt5ct export GTK2_RC_FILES="$HOME/.gtkrc-2.0" You should also make sure that these lines exist in ~/.config/Trolltech.conf : [Qt] style=GTK+ Some Qt applications gets updated on the fly, qbittorrent for instance.

item.title: mondo_generate_gtk
item.description: This is the fifth video in a series on how to setup and use my theme manager, mondo. In this video i show how i generate GTK themes from the colors set with mondo. It also describes how to add extra actions to the generators in mondo. (the only default action is to generate a file based on the template, in this video I send that generated file to an external GTK generator)

item.title: mondo_setup
item.description: This is the second video in a series on how to setup and use my theme manager, mondo. mondos settings are stored in a directory called MONDO_DIR in the documentation (mondo -h). By default this directory is: ~/.config/mondo but it can be changed with the environment variable. MONDO_DIR will get created if it doesn’t exist when you execute mondo -n THEME (create a new theme) the first time. Videos about mondo:

item.title: advanced_generators
item.description: This is the last video in a series on how to setup and use my theme manager, mondo. In this video I create a more advanced generator, that merges to files into one settings file when a theme is applied. The program i use to demonstrate this with, is the touch typing teacher: Klavaro Klavaros settings are located at: ~/.config/klavaro/preferences.ini If Klavaro is running when a theme is applied, klavaro will overwrite the new settings when it terminates.

item.title: mondo_gtk
item.description: This is the forth video in a series on how to setup and use my theme manager, mondo. In this video we investigate how GTK update and change theme. In the next video we will generate our own GTK themes with the help of mondo. I use a small program called: gtkrc-reload. You can also use gtk_reload.py from pywal . These are the files I create generators for: ~/.

item.title: mondo_generators
item.description: This is the third video in a series on how to setup and use my theme manager, mondo. In this video I walk you through how to create generators and templates. The command to create a generator is: mondo -t FILE|NAME [FILE] If you att a single file as the argument, a directory with the same name as the file will get created inside MONDO_DIR/generators/ . If you don’t specify a file, and only a name, it will have the same result except the mondo-template file will be empty.

item.title: polybar_dynamic_title
item.description: This is the last in a series of three videos on how to setup polybar. The goal of the tutorial is to create a module in polybar that displays the title of the active window, but if one clicks (or send a message via a keybinding or terminal) the title it will instead display the class and instance of the title. I will also show how we by right clicking, title/class/instance will get the clicked information in our clipboard.

item.title: sublime
item.description: sublime - Run or raise a sublime instance. SYNOPSIS sublime [-v|-h|] [-i SUBLIME_INSTANCE] DESCRIPTION This command is just a shortcut to a complex command used to run or raise sublime with a certain project and instance name. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -i SUBLIME_INSTANCE Instance name to give the notes window. Defautlt: sublime_notes ENVIRONMENT SUBLIME_INSTANCE If non-null the will rename instance name of main window.

item.title: mondo
item.description: mondo - Theme manager and generator SYNOPSIS mondo -v|-h mondo -a THEME mondo [-f] -g THEME mondo -n FILE|NAME [FILE] mondo -t FILE|NAME [FILE] DESCRIPTION mondo uses xrdb to apply colors and other settings from a theme to templates created by the user. The themes are .Xresources files. Themes are stored in MONDO_DIR/themes. Templates (mondo-template) is one file that makes up a generator. Each generator directory is located in MONDO_DIR/generator.

item.title: user-dirs
item.description: My environment dotfiles is where i setup my, well, environment. i3env are environment variables that i have invented myself and most of them are settings for various i3ass scripts. I could have put them in .bashrc, but I source them from ~/.xinitrc since all of them are specific to a graphical environment. Similarly export are environment variables that are sourced in ~/.bashrc. I try to keep most of my xsession related always start executions in ~/.

item.title: settings
item.description: There are three dotfiles that configures thunar. ~/.config/Thunar/accels.scm is where the keybindings (or accelerators, as keybindings is called in GTK) are defined. The file is autogenerated, so any formatting to the file is pointless. To modify an existing keybinding, one just remove the ; and change the last string of the line to the desired keycombination. I have filed a bugreport/feature-request regarding the keybindings: https://bugzilla.xfce.org/show_bug.cgi?id=14069 ~/.config/xfce4/xfconf/xfce-perchannel-xml/thunar.xml contains hidden settings for thunar.

Defautlt: filemanager_b ENVIRONMENT FMB_INSTANCE If non-null rename instance name of filemanager window.

item.title: foldermen
item.description: foldermen - Favorite Directory Menu SYNOPSIS foldermen [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION foldermen Launches a rofi instance with a list of directories. Selected directory will get passed to gotofolder (and opened in thunar) OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. DEPENDENCIES fontawesome rofi gotofolder thunar

item.title: gethelp
item.description: gethelp - Short description SYNOPSIS gethelp [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION When launched without CATEGORY a list of categories is displayed in a rofi menu. When CATEGORY is known, a menu with pages from that CATEGORY is shown. Depending on the CATEGORY, the chosen page is opened in sublime or surf. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. DEPENDENCIES rofi i3run sublime surf

item.title: getkeys
item.description: getkeys - Clean xev output SYNOPSIS getkeys [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION getkeys executes xev and uses i3get to get the window id of the current window, to make that the target window for xev to listen for keypresses. It then cleans the output of xev with awk. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. DEPENDENCIES i3get xev

item.title: getlink
item.description: getlink - Puts a link in the clipboard SYNOPSIS getlink [-v|-h] [CATEGORY] DESCRIPTION When script is invoked without a CATEGORY a menu (rofi) is shown asking for category. A list of files from that category is shown in a menu. Selected file translates to a url that is put both in primary selection and clipboard. Available categories: budlabs (budrich.github.io links) github (github.budrich.com links) i3docs (i3 userguide links) links (www bookmarks) pix (uploads a image in ~/pix/r and return url) OPTIONS -v Show version and exit.

item.title: gotofolder
item.description: gotofolder - Open folder and adjust layout in thunar SYNOPSIS gotofolder [-v|-h] FOLDER DESCRIPTION gotofolder opens FOLDER in thunar and adjust the layout depending on the path of the folder. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. DEPENDENCIES thunar i3get

item.title: i3cast
item.description: I use this script to create the gifs and videos you see me posting here and on youtube. It has a bunch of dependencies, but they are all good programs and the recording process is very lightweight compared to the other alternatives I’ve tried. Just run the script to start the recording, run it again to preview the video and then chose what to do. (convert to gif, upload, save e.

item.title: i3flip
item.description: I extracted and improved the tabswitching function from i3fyra and it now works independently, with or without i3fyra. i3flip - Tabswitching done right SYNOPSIS i3flip [-v|-h] [n|next|p|prev] DESCRIPTION i3flip switch containers without leaving the parent. Perfect for tabbed or stacked layout, but works on all layouts. If direction is next (or n) and the active container is the last, the first container will be activated. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit.

item.title: i3fyra
item.description: Fyra is the Swedish name for “four” (4). www.youtube.com/watch?v=kU8gb6WLFk8 . www.youtube.com/watch?v=t4Tve-xpwus In the first video above I show the functionality of i3fyra. The second video is a longer and more thorough walkthrough on how to use i3fyra 18/01/03 i3flip Tabswitching function (-t) is removed, use i3flip instead, it’s both faster and works without i3fyra 17/12/20 update: I added the ability to pass more then one containers to -z (hide).

item.title: i3get
item.description: i3get - Return information about i3wm. SYNOPSIS i3get [-h|-v] [OPTION [CRITERIA]] [-r [tcidnmwafov]] [-y] DESCRIPTION Search for CRITERIA in the output of i3-msg -t get_tree, return desired information. If no arguments are passed. con_id of acitve window is returned. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit -h Show this help -a Currently active window (default) -c CLASS Search for windows with the given class -i INSTANCE Search for windows with the given instance

item.title: i3gw
item.description: In the screenshot below, the windows to the right are tiled, and a ghostwindow is tiled on the left half of the screen. The other windows are floating. ss-i3gw1.png This might seems like a novel and unusable feature, but it is actually crucial for many of my script (i3fyra, i3var) to work. i3gw - A Ghost window wrapper for i3wm. SYNOPSIS i3gw [-v|-h] MARK DESCRIPTION i3-msg has an undocumented function: open, it creates empty containers, or as I call them: ghosts.

item.title: i3Kornhe
i3list
item.description: 18/01/03 - window geometry Added some new output values (45-55) to return the window geometry. Also AWM/TWM (mark) is deprecated, since spaces in marks caused trouble. i3list - List attributes of i3wm SYNOPSIS i3list [OPTION [CRITERIA]] DESCRIPTION This script is vital for i3fyra to work. But it can be used on it’s own or with other scripts. i3list is also used by i3run. i3list parses the output of the command:

item.title: i3minimize
item.description: i3minimize - Minimize active window SYNOPSIS i3minimize [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION Depending on the state of active window, i3minimize does different things. window state action floating send to scratchpad tiled, not handled by i3fyra send to scratchpad tiled, handled by i3fyra hide parent container OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. DEPENDENCIES i3list

item.title: i3monocle
item.description: i3monocle - Maximize active window SYNOPSIS i3monocle [-v|-h] [-g] DESCRIPTION i3monocle Will first check the floating state of the active window. If it is floating, i3fyra -a (autolayot/toggle tiling) will get invoked to ensure the window is tiled and in a i3fyra container. Then all other visible i3fyra containers will get hidden. Leaving the active window in monocle (maximized) mode. If the window is already monocled, it will be put in ZenMode with i3zen if not the -g flag is passed.

item.title: i3run
item.description: 18/01/03 - new position to mouse Floating windows now appears centered to the mouse position, but never outside the screen. Screen borders (gaps) can be fine tuned with environment variables. xdotool is a dependency now, it’s needed to get the position of the mousecursor. All windows are now hidden if targeted while they are active, if not the new -g option is set. Using i3var instead of marks. i3run - Run, Raise or hide windows in i3wm SYNOPSIS i3run -h|-v|-i|-c|-t [CRITERIA] [-g] [-e COMMAND]

item.title: i3term
item.description: I just made this script to keep my i3config cleaner. It probably needs tweaking if someone other then budRich uses it ;) i3term - Launch a command in a new urxvt window SYNOPSIS i3term [-v|-h] COMMAND DESCRIPTION Uses i3run to run or raise a window with the instancename: COMMAND. If no window is found, COMMAND is ran in a urxvt window with the same instance name as COMMAND. When the command exits window is cleared and returned to bash.

item.title: i3var
item.description: I found that marking windows is both clunky and it can have a negative impact on the workflow for users who use marks for other things. So i made i3var, it creates a ghostwindow on the scratchpad and use it to hold a variable. This can also be used for things that are not window related. I can for example keep track of my current wallpaper, but i have made some other crazy experiments with this and it works really well, much better then marks.

item.title: i3viswiz
item.description: i3viswiz - Professional window focus for i3wm SYNOPSIS i3viswiz [-v|-h] [-p] [-g GAPSIZE] [DIRECTION] DESCRIPTION i3viswiz lists all visible windows with their positions (X,Y) and dimensions (width,height). If -p flag is passed, the list will be printed to stdout. If a DIRECTION (left|right|up|down) is passed i3wizvis will shift the focus to the window closest in the given DIRECTION, or warp focus if there are no windows in the given direction.

item.title: i3wswp
item.description: i3wswp - Switch workspace and wallpaper SYNOPSIS i3wswp [-v|-h] WORKSPACE DESCRIPTION i3wswp takes a WORKSPACE number as an argument. If there exist a non empty ENVIRONMENT varialbe with the name I3WSWP_COMMAND_WORKSPACE . The content of that variable will be executed. i3wswp is intended to be used with some kind of subscriber script and be executed on workspace change. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit.

item.title: i3zen
item.description: I made a post on /r/unixporn where you can view an animated gif of i3zen in action. i3zen - Send windows to the zenter SYNOPSIS i3zen [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION Put the active window in a tabbed container between two ghostswindows (centered) on a clean workspace. If the window already is in ZenMode, move it back to it’s original workspace. If the window is not in zen but another window is, both of them will be zen in a tabbed container.

item.title: igi
item.description: This script generates an issue file that is shown when you log in to your computer without a DM. It applies the current color scheme that you have set in .Xresources ss_igi1.png igi - I Got Issues SYNOPSIS igi [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION This script creates a issuefile and move it to /etc/issue. The file will use the colors defined in .Xresources and use toilet, fortune and lolcat to create a centered fullscreen issue file.

item.title: pbtitle

EVENT OUTPUT advanced Class and instance of active window normal Title of active window color 16 colors defined in .xresources focus title When rightc licked objects will be put into the ClipBoard

item.title: pbweather

item.title: pbws
item.description: pbws - Minimal workspace indication SYNOPSIS pbws [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION pbws outputs a symbol representing the current worskpace and the total number of workspaces. Inteded to be used with polybar. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. ENVIRONMENT PBWS_SYMBOL_WORKSPACE_NUMBER This symbol will be used to indicate the current workspace, if empty the workspace number will be used. DEPENDENCIES polybar

item.title: postbanner
item.description: postbanner - Creates a colorful ASCII banner in html SYNOPSIS postbanner [-v|-h] [-o output-file] [-l lolcat-options] [-t toilet-options] TEXT DESCRIPTION postbanner creates output-file containing a multicolored ASCII text banner inside a <div> block generated from the TEXT string. ‘_’ in string creates a linebreak in the banner. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -o HTML_OUTPUT_FILE If not set output is send to stdout -l LOLCAT_OPTIONS lolcat options

item.title: postquote
item.description: postquote - Outputs a quote to html SYNOPSIS postquote [-v|-h] [[-f fortune-options] [-l MAX_LINES] [-w WRAP]] OUTPUT-FILE DESCRIPTION creates a html file with a quote from fortune inside a <div> block. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -l MAX_LINES Max number of lines in the output. If the quote exceeds MAX_LINES a new random quote will be used. Defaults to 9. -w WRAP Maximum length of each line in output.

item.title: shoot
item.description: shoot - Screenshots made easy SYNOPSIS shoot [-v|-h] DESCRIPTION When shoot is launched it displays a rofi asking what kind of screenshot to take: Fullscreen or Select area. Then screenshot is taken and the image is opened with sxiv. When sxiv is closed a new menu asks for action: Save Upload budlabs. If Upload is chosen the user is prompted for a host (imgur, ptpb), finally a name is requested.

item.title: subpro
item.description: subpro - Switch sublime projects SYNOPSIS subpro [-v|-h] project-nane DESCRIPTION subpro closes the currently open project in Sublime Text and opens project-name in it’s place. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. FILES SUBLIME_PROJECTS_DIR Folder containing .sublime-project files defaults to: ~/tmp/kortisar/sublime/projects DEPENDENCIES SublimeText

item.title: subpromen
item.description: subpromen - Switch Sublime projects with rofi SYNOPSIS subpromen [-v|-h] OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. ENVIRONMENT SUBLIME_PROJECTS_DIR Folder containing *.sublime-project files. DEPENDENCIES rofi sublime subpro

item.title: subtit
item.description: subtit - Output the currently open file in sublime. SYNOPSIS subtit [-v|-h|-l] DESCRIPTION subtit uses i3get to get the window title of Sublime Text. It extracts the filename from the title and prints it to stdout. If -l flag is passed subtit will follow symbolic links if any and print the source file. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit. -h Show help and exit. -l Follow symbolic links. -i SUBLIME_INSTANCE

item.title: templatetator
item.description: templatetator - Create files based on templates SYNOPSIS templatetator [-v|-h] [TEMPLATE_FOLDER] DESCRIPTION script that invokes a rofi with a list of folders inside TEMPLATE_FOLDER. folder. It then runs the recipie file in the selected folder. It then prompts for a filename of the new file. The variables, CURFLD (the selected template folder) and CURFIL (the entered filename) can be used in the recepie file. OPTIONS -v Show version and exit.

item.title: new_ass_features
item.description: I have made lots of small updates and additions to i3ass the last couple of weeks. The changes might seem small and subtle, but they have improved the experience a lot. I can now hide an active a container by running i3run on the active window, this is a much better way then using the move commands all the time. And floating windows now appear centered to the mouse position, but adjusted to the screenedges.

item.title: i3_flipping_tabs
item.description: I have gotten some requests on an isolated version of i3fyra’s tabswitching function. And this morning I sat down to try a new way to do it, and it worked .. pretty, pretty, pretty good :) Vanilla i3 doesn’t have a separate function for switching tabs, instead we use the normal focus [left|right]. This is not so well suited for tabs since if one focus right when the last tab is active, the focus will pop out to the container to the right if there is one.

item.title: ass_divided
item.description: I have divided i3ass in two repositories, i3ass and i3add (i3 additions). My thought is that i3ass will be a more serious set of tools. While i3add will be more experimental and can be seen as a showcase of uses for i3ass. I do use all i3add scripts in my personal, daily workflow. i3ass function i3var Set or get a i3 variable i3fyra An advanced simple gridbased tiling layout i3run Run, Raise or hide windows i3list List attributes of i3wm i3get Return information about i3wm i3flip Tabswitching done right i3add function i3cast Create and upload screen recordings i3Kornhe Resize windows by moving the corners i3minimize Minimize active window i3monocle Maximize active window i3zen Send windows to the zenter i3term Launch a command in a new urxvt window i3wswp Switch workspace and wallpaper Installation i3add will have a installation script similar to the old install.

item.title: i3_size_matters
item.description: I just recorded and uploaded a video to youtube, where i show a technique to resize floating window by moving the corners and still being able to resize tiling windows with the same keybindings. sizematters.gif The config file and script shown in the video can be found on GitHub.

item.title: i3fyra

item.title: the_site
item.description: This site is made using the static site generator Hugo and the text editor Sublime Text, using GNU/Linux as an IDE. I wanted a static site because cutting edge web development techniques and bloated IDE’s is not an environment I like. I have promised myself that the rendered site should only be HTML/CSS (except for google analytics and disqus). There is a lot of crazy stuff and bash scripting involved in creating the site, but that doesn’t affect the finished site or your RAM and bandwidth usage.

item.title: fresh_start
item.description: These are the steps I take to setup my work environment on a fresh install of Peppermint OS 8. Most of the steps are valid on other GNU/Linux distributions, but I don’t recommend anyone to blindly follow and install everything. Before doing anything else i start syncing Dropbox. I start with this step because it can take up to 45 minutes, so while Dropbox is syncing there is time to install and setup other programs.

item.title: mouseback
item.description: A while ago I got irritated how messy my i3 config file looked, and I researched alternative hotkey managers. I tried sxhkd and it is a fine piece of code. I got a much cleaner setup of the hotkeys and I could do stuff that i wasn’t able to do with i3. But a couple of days ago, i realized that my i3 config could be just as clean as sxhkd by using variables.

item.title: swedish_keyboards
item.description: when I was working as a technical support agent I received several calls from angry men who couldn’t find the @ symbol on the keyboard. When I explained that they had to hold Alt-Gr and pressing 2 at the same time, they exploded with anger and told me to tell the technicians to make a new keyboard layout! I explained it’s an old standard and agreed it was stupid, but that it would probably never change.

item.title: me_myself_and_i3
item.description: Or, how I became a tiler i3 is a dynamic window manager for X. I use i3, and I really like it. There are many similar window managers and I haven’t tried many of them. I have run and tinkered with bug.n on windows and tested awesome and dwm on GNU/Linux. Maybe I was unlucky and had bad timing with awesome, I was very fresh on GNU/Linux and I think the awesome project was in a transition phase, but I had a hard time grasping all of it.

item.title: install_i3
item.description: You can probably install i3 directly from your distributions package manager. But If you want to be sure to get the latest version or a fork you need to download and compile the source code. i3-gaps i3-gaps is a fork of i3 developed by Airblader who happens to be one of the main developers on vanilla/normal i3. i3-gaps has some features that is not 100% in sync with the design philosophy of normal i3, that’s why it is a fork.

item.title: i3_setup
item.description: These are some of my personal preferences and thoughts on how to configure i3. Read the official userguide often to see what options you got. I have left out a lot of functionality in my config that i don’t use. Your config file can be located at different places depending on how you installed i3. variables the first line of the default config file looks like this: set $mod Mod4
